summary.long: 2 Chronicles is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: Now Solomon the son of David established himself securely over his kingdom, and the Lord his God was with him and exalted him greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Solomon spoke to all Israel, to the commanders of thousands, of hundreds, and to the judges and to every leader in all Israel, the heads of the fathers’ households.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon and all the assembly with him went to the high place which was at Gibeon, because God’s tent of meeting was there which Moses, the servant of the Lord had made in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, David had brought up the ark of God from Kiriath-jearim to the place he had prepared for it, for he had pitched a tent for it in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the bronze altar which Bezalel, the son of Uri, the son of Hur, had made was there before the tabernacle of the Lord, and Solomon and the assembly sought it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Solomon went up there before the Lord to the bronze altar which was at the tent of meeting, and offered a thousand burnt offerings on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that night God appeared to Solomon and said to him, “Ask what I shall give you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Solomon said to God, “You have dealt with my father David with great faithfulness, and have made me king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, Lord God, Your promise to my father David is fulfilled, for You have made me king over a people as numerous as the dust of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now give me wisdom and knowledge, so that I may go out and come in before this people, for who can rule this great people of Yours?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said to Solomon, “Because this was in your heart, and you did not ask for riches, wealth, or honor, or the life of those who hate you, nor did you even ask for long life, but you asked for yourself wisdom and knowledge so that you may rule My people over whom I have made you king,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: wisdom and knowledge have been granted to you. I will also give you riches, wealth, and honor, such as none of the kings who were before you has possessed, nor will those who will come after you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Solomon went from the high place which was at Gibeon, from the tent of meeting, to Jerusalem, and he reigned over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon amassed chariots and horsemen. He had 1,400 chariots and twelve thousand horsemen, and he stationed them in the chariot cities and with the king in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king made silver and gold as plentiful in Jerusalem as stones, and he made cedars as plentiful as sycamores in the lowland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon’s horses were imported from Egypt and from Kue; the king’s traders acquired them from Kue for a price.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They imported chariots from Egypt for six hundred shekels of silver apiece, horses for 150 apiece, and by the same means they exported them to all the kings of the Hittites and the kings of Aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Solomon decided to build a house for the name of the Lord, and a royal palace for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Solomon assigned seventy thousand men to carry loads, eighty thousand men to quarry stone in the mountains, and 3,600 to supervise them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon sent word to Huram the king of Tyre, saying, “As you dealt with my father David and sent him cedars to build him a house to live in, do it for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am about to build a house for the name of the Lord my God, dedicating it to Him, to burn fragrant incense before Him and to set out the showbread continually, and to offer burnt offerings morning and evening, on Sabbaths, on new moons, and on the appointed feasts of the Lord our God. This is to be done in Israel forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The house which I am about to build will be great, for our God is greater than all the gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But who is able to build a house for Him, since the heavens and the highest heavens cannot contain Him? And who am I, that I should build a house for Him, except to burn incense before Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now send me a skilled man to work in gold, silver, brass, iron, and in purple, crimson, and violet fabrics, one who knows how to make engravings, to work with the skilled workers whom I have in Judah and Jerusalem, whom my father David provided.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send me also cedar, juniper, and algum timber from Lebanon, for I know that your servants know how to cut timber of Lebanon; and indeed my servants will work with your servants,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to prepare timber in abundance for me, for the house which I am about to build will be great and wonderful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now behold, I will give your servants, the woodsmen who cut the timber, twenty thousand kors of crushed wheat, twenty thousand kors of barley, twenty thousand baths of wine, and twenty thousand baths of oil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Huram, king of Tyre, answered in a letter sent to Solomon: “Because the Lord loves His people, He has made you king over them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Huram continued, “Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, who made heaven and earth, who has given King David a wise son, endowed with discretion and understanding, who will build a house for the Lord and a royal palace for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now then, I am sending Huram-abi, a skilled man, endowed with understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of a Danite woman and a Tyrian father, who knows how to work in gold, silver, bronze, iron, stone, and wood, and in purple, violet, linen, and crimson fabrics, and who knows how to make all kinds of engravings and to execute any design which is assigned to him, to work with your skilled workers and with those of my lord, your father David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then, let my lord send his servants wheat and barley, oil and wine, of which he has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will cut whatever timber you need from Lebanon and bring it to you as rafts by sea to Joppa, so that you may carry it up to Jerusalem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon counted all the foreigners who were in the land of Israel, following the census which his father David had taken; and 153,600 were found.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He appointed seventy thousand of them to carry loads and eighty thousand to quarry stones in the mountains, and 3,600 supervisors to make the people work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon began to build the house of the Lord in Jerusalem on Mount Moriah, where the Lord had appeared to his father David, at the place that David had prepared on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began to build on the second day in the second month of the fourth year of his reign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the foundations which Solomon laid for building the house of God. The length in cubits, according to the old standard, was sixty cubits, and the width, twenty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The porch which was in front of the house was as long as the width of the house, twenty cubits, and the height twenty; and inside he overlaid it with pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He overlaid the main room with juniper wood and overlaid it with fine gold; and he ornamented it with palm trees and chains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Further, he overlaid the house with precious stones; and the gold was gold from Parvaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also overlaid the house with gold—the beams, the thresholds, and its walls and doors; and he carved cherubim on the walls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made the room of the Most Holy Place: its length across the width of the house was twenty cubits, and its width was twenty cubits; and he overlaid it with fine gold, amounting to six hundred talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The weight of the nails was fifty shekels of gold. He also overlaid the upper rooms with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made two sculptured cherubim in the room of the Most Holy Place and overlaid them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wingspan of the cherubim was twenty cubits; the wing of one, of five cubits, touched the wall of the house, and its other wing, of five cubits, touched the wing of the other cherub.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wing of the other cherub, of five cubits, touched the wall of the house; and its other wing, of five cubits, was attached to the wing of the first cherub.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wings of these cherubim extended twenty cubits, and they stood on their feet facing the main room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the veil of violet, purple, crimson, and fine linen, and he worked cherubim into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also made two pillars for the front of the house, thirty-five cubits high, and the capital on the top of each was five cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made chains in the inner sanctuary and placed them on the tops of the pillars; and he made a hundred pomegranates and placed them on the chains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He erected the pillars in front of the temple, one on the right and the other on the left, and named the one on the right Jachin and the one on the left Boaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made a bronze altar, twenty cubits in length, twenty cubits in width, and ten cubits in height.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also made the Sea of cast metal, ten cubits from brim to brim, circular in form, and its height was five cubits and its circumference thirty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now figures like oxen were under it and all around it, ten cubits, entirely encircling the Sea. The oxen were in two rows, cast in one piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was standing on twelve oxen, three facing north, three facing west, three facing south, and three facing east; and the Sea was set on top of them and all their hindquarters turned inward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was a hand width thick, and its brim was made like the brim of a cup, like a lily blossom; it could hold three thousand baths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also made ten basins in which to wash, and he set five on the right side and five on the left to rinse things for the burnt offering; but the Sea was for the priests to wash in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made the ten golden lampstands in the way prescribed for them, and he set them in the temple, five on the right side and five on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also made ten tables and placed them in the temple, five on the right side and five on the left. And he made a hundred golden bowls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made the courtyard of the priests and the great courtyard, and doors for the courtyard, and overlaid their doors with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the Sea on the right side of the house toward the southeast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Huram also made the pails, the shovels, and the bowls. So Huram finished the work that he did for King Solomon in the house of God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the two pillars, the bowls and the two capitals on top of the pillars, and the two latticeworks to cover the two bowls of the capitals which were on top of the pillars,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the four hundred pomegranates for the two latticeworks, two rows of pomegranates for each latticework to cover the two bowls of the capitals which were on the pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also made the stands and he made the basins on the stands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the one Sea with the twelve oxen under it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The pails, the shovels, the forks, and all its utensils, Huram-abi made of polished bronze for King Solomon, for the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the plain of the Jordan the king cast them in the clay ground between Succoth and Zeredah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Solomon made all these utensils in great quantities, for the weight of the bronze could not be determined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon also made all the things that were in the house of God: the golden altar, the tables with the bread of the Presence on them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the lampstands with their lamps of pure gold, to burn in front of the inner sanctuary in the way prescribed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the flowers, the lamps, and the tongs of gold, that is, of purest gold;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the snuffers, the bowls, the spoons, and the firepans of pure gold; and the entrance of the house, its inner doors for the Most Holy Place and the doors of the house, that is, of the main room, of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the work that Solomon performed for the house of the Lord was finished. And Solomon brought in the things that his father David had dedicated, the silver, the gold, and all the utensils, and he put them in the treasuries of the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon assembled at Jerusalem the elders of Israel, all the heads of the tribes, and the leaders of the fathers’ households of the sons of Israel, to bring the ark of the covenant of the Lord up from the city of David, which is Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the men of Israel assembled themselves before the king at the feast, that is in the seventh month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the elders of Israel came, and the Levites picked up the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought up the ark, the tent of meeting, and all the holy utensils that were in the tent. The Levitical priests brought them up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And King Solomon and all the congregation of Israel who had assembled with him before the ark were sacrificing so many sheep and oxen that they could not be counted or numbered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priests brought the ark of the covenant of the Lord to its place, into the inner sanctuary of the house, to the Most Holy Place, under the wings of the cherubim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the cherubim spread their wings over the place of the ark, so that the cherubim made a covering over the ark and its poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poles were so long that the ends of the poles of the ark could be seen in front of the inner sanctuary, but they could not be seen outside; and they are there to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was nothing in the ark except the two tablets which Moses put there at Horeb, where the Lord made a covenant with the sons of Israel, when they came out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the priests came out from the holy place (for all the priests who were present had sanctified themselves, without regard to divisions),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the Levitical singers, Asaph, Heman, Jeduthun, and their sons and kinsmen, clothed in fine linen, with cymbals, harps, and lyres, standing east of the altar, and with them 120 priests blowing trumpets
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in unison when the trumpeters and the singers were to make themselves heard with one voice to praise and to glorify the Lord, and when they raised their voices accompanied by trumpets, cymbals, and other musical instruments, and when they praised the Lord saying, “He indeed is good for His kindness is everlasting,” then the house, the house of the Lord, was filled with a cloud,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the priests could not rise to minister because of the cloud, for the glory of the Lord filled the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Solomon said,
“The Lord has said that He would dwell in the thick darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have built You a lofty house,
And a place for Your dwelling forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king turned around and blessed all the assembly of Israel, while all the assembly of Israel was standing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, who spoke with His mouth to my father David, and fulfilled it with His hands, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Since the day that I brought My people from the land of Egypt, I did not choose a city out of all the tribes of Israel in which to build a house, so that My name might be there, nor did I choose a man to be the leader over My people Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I have chosen Jerusalem so that My name might be there, and I have chosen David to be over My people Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was in the heart of my father David to build a house for the name of the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to my father David, ‘Because it was in your heart to build a house for My name, you did well that it was in your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless you shall not build the house, but your son who will be born to you, he shall build the house for My name.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord has fulfilled His word which He spoke; for I have risen in place of my father David and sit on the throne of Israel, as the Lord promised, and have built the house for the name of the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There I have placed the ark in which is the covenant of the Lord, which He made with the sons of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he stood before the altar of the Lord in the presence of all the assembly of Israel and spread out his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Solomon had made a bronze platform, five cubits long, five cubits wide, and three cubits high, and had set it in the midst of the courtyard; and he stood on it, knelt on his knees in the presence of all the assembly of Israel and spread out his hands toward heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Lord, God of Israel, there is no god like You in heaven or on earth, keeping Your covenant and Your faithfulness to Your servants who walk before You with all their heart;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You who have kept with Your servant, my father David, that which You promised him; You have spoken with Your mouth and have fulfilled it with Your hand, as it is this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then, Lord, God of Israel, keep to Your servant David, my father, that which You promised him, saying, ‘You shall not lack a man to sit on the throne of Israel, if only your sons pay attention to their way, to walk in My Law as you have walked before Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then, Lord, God of Israel, let Your word be confirmed which You have spoken to Your servant David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But will God really dwell with mankind on the earth? Behold, heaven and the highest heaven cannot contain You; how much less this house which I have built!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, turn Your attention to the prayer of Your servant and to his plea, Lord, my God, to listen to the cry and to the prayer which Your servant prays before You;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that Your eye will be open toward this house day and night, toward the place of which You have said that You would put Your name there, to listen to the prayer which Your servant shall pray toward this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen to the pleadings of Your servant and of Your people Israel when they pray toward this place; hear from Your dwelling place, from heaven; hear and forgive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If someone sins against his neighbor and is made to take an oath, and he comes and takes an oath before Your altar in this house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hear from heaven and take action and judge Your servants, punishing the wicked by bringing his way on his own head, and justifying the righteous by repaying him according to his righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If Your people Israel are defeated before an enemy because they have sinned against You, and they return to You and praise Your name, and pray and plead before You in this house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hear from heaven and forgive the sin of Your people Israel, and bring them back to the land which You have given to them and to their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the heavens are shut up and there is no rain because they have sinned against You, and they pray toward this place and praise Your name, and turn from their sin when You afflict them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hear in heaven and forgive the sin of Your servants and Your people Israel; indeed, teach them the good way in which they are to walk. And provide rain on Your land, which You have given to Your people as an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If there is a famine in the land, if there is a plague, if there is blight or mildew, if there is locust or grasshopper, if their enemies besiege them in the land of their cities, whatever plague or whatever sickness there is,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whatever prayer or plea is made by anyone or by all Your people Israel, each knowing his own affliction and his own pain, and spreading his hands toward this house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hear from heaven, Your dwelling place, and forgive, and render to each according to all his ways, whose heart You know—for You alone know the hearts of the sons of mankind—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that they may fear You, to walk in Your ways as long as they live in the land which You have given to our fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Also concerning the foreigner who is not from Your people Israel, when he comes from a far country on account of Your great name and Your mighty hand and Your outstretched arm, when they come and pray toward this house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hear from heaven, from Your dwelling place, and do according to all for which the foreigner calls to You, so that all the peoples of the earth may know Your name, and fear You as do Your people Israel, and that they may know that this house which I have built is called by Your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When Your people go out to battle against their enemies, by whatever way You send them, and they pray to You toward this city which You have chosen and the house which I have built for Your name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hear from heaven their prayer and their pleading, and maintain their cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When they sin against You (for there is no one who does not sin), and You are angry with them and turn them over to an enemy, so that they take them away captive to a land far off or near,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if they take it to heart in the land where they are taken captive, and repent and plead to You in the land of their captivity, saying, ‘We have sinned, we have done wrong and have acted wickedly’;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if they return to You with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their captivity, where they have been taken captive, and pray toward their land which You have given to their fathers and the city which You have chosen, and toward the house which I have built for Your name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hear from heaven, from Your dwelling place, their prayer and pleadings, and maintain their cause, and forgive Your people who have sinned against You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now, my God, please, let Your eyes be open and Your ears attentive to the prayer offered in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now then arise, Lord God, to Your resting place, You and the ark of Your might; let Your priests, Lord God, be clothed with salvation, and let Your godly ones rejoice in what is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lord God, do not turn away the face of Your anointed; remember Your faithfulness to Your servant David.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Solomon had finished praying, fire came down from heaven and consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices, and the glory of the Lord filled the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priests could not enter the house of the Lord because the glory of the Lord filled the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the sons of Israel, seeing the fire come down and the glory of the Lord upon the house, bowed down on the pavement with their faces to the ground, and they worshiped and gave praise to the Lord, saying, “Certainly He is good, certainly His faithfulness is everlasting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king and all the people offered sacrifice before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Solomon offered a sacrifice of twenty-two thousand oxen and 120,000 sheep. So the king and all the people dedicated the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests stood at their posts, and the Levites also, with the musical instruments for the Lord, which King David had made for giving praise to the Lord—“for His faithfulness is everlasting”—whenever David gave praise through their ministry; the priests on the other side blew trumpets and all Israel was standing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon consecrated the middle of the courtyard that was before the house of the Lord, for he offered the burnt offerings and the fat of the peace offerings there, because the bronze altar which Solomon had made was not able to contain the burnt offering, the grain offering, and the fat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Solomon held the feast at that time for seven days, and all Israel with him, a very great assembly that came from the entrance of Hamath to the brook of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the eighth day they held a solemn assembly, because they held the dedication of the altar for seven days, and the feast for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then on the twenty-third day of the seventh month he sent the people to their tents, rejoicing and happy in heart because of the goodness that the Lord had shown to David, to Solomon, and to His people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Solomon finished the house of the Lord and the king’s palace, and successfully completed everything that he had planned on doing in the house of the Lord and in his palace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord appeared to Solomon at night and said to him, “I have heard your prayer and have chosen this place for Myself as a house of sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I shut up the heavens so that there is no rain, or if I command the locust to devour the land, or if I send a plague among My people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and My people who are called by My name humble themselves, and pray and seek My face, and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven, and I will forgive their sin and will heal their land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now My eyes will be open and My ears attentive to the prayer offered in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now I have chosen and consecrated this house so that My name may be there forever, and My eyes and My heart will be there always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for you, if you walk before Me as your father David walked, to do according to everything that I have commanded you, and keep My statutes and My ordinances,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will establish your royal throne as I covenanted with your father David, saying, ‘You shall not lack a man to be ruler in Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if you turn away and abandon My statutes and My commandments which I have set before you, and go and serve other gods and worship them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will uproot you from My land which I have given you, and this house which I have consecrated for My name I will cast out of My sight; and I will make it a proverb and an object of scorn among all peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for this house, which was exalted, everyone who passes by it will be astonished and say, ‘Why has the Lord done these things to this land and to this house?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will say, ‘Because they abandoned the Lord, the God of their fathers, who brought them from the land of Egypt, and they adopted other gods, and worshiped and served them; therefore He has brought all this adversity on them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about at the end of the twenty years in which Solomon had built the house of the Lord and his own house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that he built the cities which Huram had given him, and settled the sons of Israel there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon went to Hamath-zobah and captured it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built Tadmor in the wilderness and all the storage cities which he had built in Hamath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also built upper Beth-horon and lower Beth-horon, which were fortified cities with walls, gates, and bars;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Baalath and all the storage cities that Solomon had, and all the cities for his chariots and cities for his horsemen, and everything that it pleased Solomon to build in Jerusalem, Lebanon, and all the land under his rule.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of the people who were left of the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, who were not of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that is, from their descendants who were left after them in the land, whom the sons of Israel had not destroyed, Solomon raised them as forced laborers to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Solomon did not make slaves from the sons of Israel for his work; for they were men of war, his chief captains and commanders of his chariots and his horsemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the chief officers of King Solomon, 250 who ruled over the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon brought Pharaoh’s daughter up from the city of David to the house which he had built for her, for he said, “My wife shall not live in the house of David king of Israel, because the places where the ark of the Lord has entered are holy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon offered burnt offerings to the Lord on the altar of the Lord which he had built in front of the porch;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he did so according to the daily rule, offering them up according to the commandment of Moses, for the Sabbaths, the new moons, and the three annual feasts—the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Booths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now according to the ordinance of his father David, he appointed the divisions of the priests for their service, and the Levites for their duties of praise and ministering before the priests according to the daily rule, and the gatekeepers by their divisions at every gate; for this is what David, the man of God, had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did not deviate from the commandment of the king to the priests and Levites in any matter or regarding the storehouses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the work of Solomon was carried out from the day of the foundation of the house of the Lord, until it was finished. So the house of the Lord was completed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon went to Ezion-geber and to Eloth on the seashore in the land of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by his servants Huram sent him ships and servants who knew the sea; and they went with Solomon’s servants to Ophir and took from there 450 talents of gold, and brought it to King Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the queen of Sheba heard about the fame of Solomon, she came to Jerusalem to test Solomon with riddles. She had a very large entourage, with camels carrying balsam oil and a large amount of gold and precious stones; and when she came to Solomon, she spoke with him about everything that was on her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon answered all her questions; nothing was hidden from Solomon which he did not explain to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the queen of Sheba had seen the wisdom of Solomon, the house which he had built,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the food at his table, the seating of his servants, the attendance of his ministers and their attire, his cupbearers and their attire, and his stairway by which he went up to the house of the Lord, she was breathless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she said to the king, “It was a true story that I heard in my own land about your words and your wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I did not believe their stories until I came and my own eyes saw it all. And behold, not even half of the greatness of your wisdom was reported to me. You have surpassed the report that I heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How blessed are your men, how blessed are these servants of yours, who stand before you continually and hear your wisdom!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the Lord your God who delighted in you, setting you on His throne as king for the Lord your God; because your God loved Israel, establishing them forever, He made you king over them, to carry out justice and righteousness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she gave the king 120 talents of gold and a very great amount of balsam oil and precious stones; there had never been balsam oil like that which the queen of Sheba gave King Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servants of Huram and the servants of Solomon who brought gold from Ophir, also brought algum trees and precious stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the algum trees the king made steps to the house of the Lord and for the king’s palace, and lyres and harps for the singers; and nothing like them was seen before in the land of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Solomon gave the queen of Sheba her every desire, whatever she requested, besides gifts equal to what she had brought to the king. Then she turned and went to her own land with her servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was 666 talents of gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: besides what the traders and merchants brought; and all the kings of Arabia and the governors of the country brought gold and silver to Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Solomon made two hundred large shields of beaten gold, using six hundred shekels of beaten gold on each large shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made three hundred shields of beaten gold, using three hundred shekels of gold on each shield; and the king put them in the house of the forest of Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were six steps to the throne and a footstool in gold attached to the throne, and arms on each side of the seat, and two lions standing beside the arms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Twelve lions were standing there on the six steps on the one side and on the other; nothing like it was made for any other kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All King Solomon’s drinking vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold; silver was not considered valuable in the days of Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the king had ships which went to Tarshish with the servants of Huram; once every three years the ships of Tarshish came bringing gold and silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So King Solomon became greater than all the kings of the earth in wealth and wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the kings of the earth were seeking the presence of Solomon, to hear his wisdom which God had put in his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were bringing, each of them his gift: articles of silver and gold, garments, weapons, balsam oil, horses, and mules, so much year by year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Solomon had four thousand stalls for horses and chariots and twelve thousand horsemen, and he stationed them in the chariot cities and with the king in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was ruler over all the kings from the Euphrates River to the land of the Philistines, and as far as the border of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king made silver as common as stones in Jerusalem, and he made cedars as plentiful as sycamore trees that are in the lowland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were bringing horses for Solomon from Egypt and from all countries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Solomon, from the first to the last, are they not written in the records of Nathan the prophet, in the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and in the visions of Iddo the seer concerning Jeroboam the son of Nebat?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel for forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Solomon lay down with his fathers and was buried in the city of his father David; and his son Rehoboam reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rehoboam went to Shechem, because all Israel had come to Shechem to make him king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jeroboam the son of Nebat heard about it (he was in Egypt where he had fled from the presence of King Solomon), Jeroboam returned from Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they sent word and summoned him. When Jeroboam and all Israel came, they spoke to Rehoboam, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Your father made our yoke hard; but now, lighten the hard labor imposed by your father and his heavy yoke which he put on us, and we will serve you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Return to me again in three days.” So the people departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then King Rehoboam consulted with the elders who had served his father Solomon while he was still alive, saying, “How do you advise me to answer this people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They spoke to him, saying, “If you are kind to this people and please them and speak pleasant words to them, then they will be your servants always.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he ignored the advice of the elders which they had given him, and consulted with the young men who had grown up with him and served him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “What advice do you give, so that we may answer this people, who have spoken to me, saying, ‘Lighten the yoke which your father put on us’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young men who had grown up with him spoke to him, saying, “This is what you should say to the people who spoke to you, saying: ‘Your father made our yoke heavy, but you make it lighter for us!’ You should speak this way to them: ‘My little finger is thicker than my father’s waist!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then, my father loaded you with a heavy yoke; yet I will add to your yoke. My father disciplined you with whips, but I will discipline you with scorpions!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam on the third day, just as the king had directed, saying, “Return to me on the third day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king answered them harshly, and King Rehoboam ignored the advice of the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke to them according to the advice of the young men, saying, “My father made your yoke heavy, but I will add to it; my father disciplined you with whips, but I will discipline you with scorpions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king did not listen to the people, because it was a turn of events from God so that the Lord might establish His word, which He spoke through Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When all Israel saw that the king had not listened to them, the people replied to the king, saying,
“What share do we have in David?
We have no inheritance in the son of Jesse.
Everyone to your tents, Israel!
Now look after your own house, David!”
So all Israel went away to their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for the sons of Israel who lived in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam reigned over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Rehoboam sent Hadoram, who was in charge of the forced labor, and the sons of Israel stoned him to death. And King Rehoboam hurried to mount his chariot to flee to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Israel has been in rebellion against the house of David to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Rehoboam had come to Jerusalem, he assembled the house of Judah and Benjamin, 180,000 chosen warriors, to fight against Israel to restore the kingdom to Rehoboam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the word of the Lord came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell Rehoboam the son of Solomon, king of Judah, and all Israel in Judah and Benjamin, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord says: “You shall not go up nor fight against your relatives; return, every man, to his house, for this event is from Me.”’” So they listened to the words of the Lord and returned from going against Jeroboam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rehoboam lived in Jerusalem and built cities for defense in Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built Bethlehem, Etam, Tekoa,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth-zur, Soco, Adullam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gath, Mareshah, Ziph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adoraim, Lachish, Azekah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zorah, Aijalon, and Hebron, which are fortified cities in Judah and Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also strengthened the fortresses and put officers in them and supplies of food, oil, and wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put shields and spears in every city and strengthened them greatly. So he held Judah and Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the priests and the Levites who were in all Israel also stood with him from all their districts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Levites left their pasture lands and their property and went to Judah and Jerusalem, because Jeroboam and his sons had excluded them from serving as priests to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set up priests of his own for the high places, for the satyrs and the calves which he had made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those from all the tribes of Israel who set their hearts on seeking the Lord God of Israel followed them to Jerusalem, to sacrifice to the Lord God of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They strengthened the kingdom of Judah and supported Rehoboam the son of Solomon for three years, for they walked in the way of David and Solomon for three years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rehoboam married Mahalath the daughter of Jerimoth the son of David and of Abihail the daughter of Eliab the son of Jesse,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she bore to him sons: Jeush, Shemariah, and Zaham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After her he married Maacah the daughter of Absalom, and she bore to him Abijah, Attai, Ziza, and Shelomith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rehoboam loved Maacah the daughter of Absalom more than all his other wives and concubines. For he had taken eighteen wives and sixty concubines, and fathered twenty-eight sons and sixty daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rehoboam appointed Abijah the son of Maacah as head and leader among his brothers, for he intended to make him king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He acted wisely and distributed some of his sons through all the territories of Judah and Benjamin to all the fortified cities, and he gave them plenty of provisions. And he sought many wives for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the kingdom of Rehoboam was established and strong, he and all Israel with him abandoned the Law of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came about in King Rehoboam’s fifth year, because they had been unfaithful to the Lord, that Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with 1,200 chariots and sixty thousand horsemen. And the people who came with him from Egypt were innumerable: the Lubim, the Sukkiim, and the Ethiopians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he captured the fortified cities of Judah and came as far as Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Shemaiah the prophet came to Rehoboam and the princes of Judah who had gathered at Jerusalem because of Shishak, and he said to them, “This is what the Lord says: ‘You have abandoned Me, so I also have abandoned you to Shishak.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the princes of Israel and the king humbled themselves and said, “The Lord is righteous.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord saw that they had humbled themselves, the word of the Lord came to Shemaiah, saying, “They have humbled themselves, so I will not destroy them; and I will grant them a little deliverance, and My wrath will not be poured out on Jerusalem by means of Shishak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they will become his slaves, so that they may learn the difference between My service and the service of the kingdoms of the countries.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Shishak king of Egypt went up against Jerusalem, and he took the treasures of the house of the Lord and the treasures of the king’s palace. He took everything; he even took the gold shields which Solomon had made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Rehoboam made shields of bronze in their place and committed them to the care of the commanders of the guards who guarded the entrance of the king’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As often as the king entered the house of the Lord, the guards came and carried them and then brought them back into the guards’ room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he humbled himself, the anger of the Lord turned away from him, so as not to destroy him completely; and conditions were also good in Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So King Rehoboam became powerful in Jerusalem and reigned there. For Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which the Lord had chosen from all the tribes of Israel, to put His name there. And his mother’s name was Naamah the Ammonitess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he did evil because he did not set his heart to seek the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the acts of Rehoboam, from the first to the last, are they not written in the records of Shemaiah the prophet and of Iddo the seer, according to genealogical enrollment? And there were wars between Rehoboam and Jeroboam continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Rehoboam lay down with his fathers and was buried in the city of David; and his son Abijah became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam, Abijah became king over Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He reigned in Jerusalem for three years; and his mother’s name was Micaiah the daughter of Uriel of Gibeah.
Now there was war between Abijah and Jeroboam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abijah began the battle with an army of warriors, four hundred thousand chosen men, while Jeroboam drew up in battle formation against him with eight hundred thousand chosen men who were valiant warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abijah stood on Mount Zemaraim, which is in the hill country of Ephraim, and said, “Listen to me, Jeroboam and all Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that the Lord God of Israel gave the rule over Israel forever to David and his sons by a covenant of salt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet Jeroboam the son of Nebat, the servant of Solomon the son of David, rose up and rebelled against his master,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and worthless men gathered to him, wicked men, who proved too strong for Rehoboam, the son of Solomon, when he was young and timid and could not hold his own against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So now you intend to assert yourselves against the kingdom of the Lord through the sons of David, being a great multitude and having with you the golden calves which Jeroboam made for you as gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have you not driven out the priests of the Lord, the sons of Aaron and the Levites, and made for yourselves priests like the peoples of other lands? Whoever comes to consecrate himself with a bull and seven rams, even he may become a priest of things that are not gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for us, the Lord is our God, and we have not abandoned Him; and the sons of Aaron are ministering to the Lord as priests, and the Levites attend to their work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every morning and evening they burn to the Lord burnt offerings and fragrant incense, and the showbread is set on the clean table, and the golden lampstand with its lamps is ready to light every evening; for we perform our duty to the Lord our God, but you have abandoned Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now behold, God is with us at our head, and His priests with the signal trumpets to sound the war cry against you. Sons of Israel, do not fight against the Lord God of your fathers, for you will not succeed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jeroboam had set an ambush to come from behind, so that Israel was in front of Judah and the ambush was behind them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Judah turned around, behold, they were attacked both from front and rear; so they cried out to the Lord, and the priests blew the trumpets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men of Judah raised a war cry, and when the men of Judah raised the war cry, God defeated Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sons of Israel fled from Judah, God handed them over to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abijah and his people defeated them with a great slaughter, so that five hundred thousand chosen men of Israel fell slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Israel were subdued at that time, and the sons of Judah conquered because they trusted in the Lord, the God of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abijah pursued Jeroboam and captured from him several cities, Bethel with its villages, Jeshanah with its villages, and Ephron with its villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeroboam did not again recover strength in the days of Abijah; and the Lord struck him and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abijah became powerful, and he took fourteen wives for himself, and fathered twenty-two sons and sixteen daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Abijah, and his ways and his words are written in the treatise of Iddo the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abijah lay down with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David, and his son Asa became king in his place. The land was undisturbed for ten years during his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Asa did what was good and right in the sight of the Lord his God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he removed the foreign altars and high places, tore down the memorial stones, cut down the Asherim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and commanded Judah to seek the Lord God of their fathers and to comply with the Law and the commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also removed the high places and the incense altars from all the cities of Judah. And the kingdom was undisturbed under him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built fortified cities in Judah, since the land was undisturbed, and there was no one at war with him during those years, because the Lord had given him rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he said to Judah, “Let’s build these cities and surround them with walls and towers, gates and bars. The land is still ours because we have sought the Lord our God; we have sought Him, and He has given us rest on every side.” So they built and prospered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Asa had an army of three hundred thousand from Judah, carrying large shields and spears, and 280,000 from Benjamin, carrying shields and wielding bows; all of them were valiant warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Zerah the Ethiopian went out against them with an army of a million men and three hundred chariots, and he came to Mareshah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Asa went out to meet him, and they drew up in battle formation in the Valley of Zephathah at Mareshah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Asa called to the Lord his God and said, “Lord, there is no one besides You to help in the battle between the powerful and those who have no strength; help us, Lord our God, for we trust in You, and in Your name have come against this multitude. Lord, You are our God; do not let man prevail against You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord routed the Ethiopians before Asa and before Judah, and the Ethiopians fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asa and the people who were with him pursued them as far as Gerar; and so many Ethiopians fell that they could not recover, for they were shattered before the Lord and before His army. And they carried away a very large amount of plunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They destroyed all the cities around Gerar, for the dread of the Lord had fallen on them; and they pillaged all the cities, for there was much plunder in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also fatally struck those who owned livestock, and they led away large numbers of sheep and camels. Then they returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Spirit of God came on Azariah the son of Oded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he went out to meet Asa and said to him, “Listen to me, Asa, and all Judah and Benjamin: the Lord is with you when you are with Him. And if you seek Him, He will let you find Him; but if you abandon Him, He will abandon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many days Israel was without the true God and without a teaching priest and without the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in their distress they turned to the Lord God of Israel, and they sought Him, and He let them find Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those times there was no peace for him who went out or him who came in, because many disturbances afflicted all the inhabitants of the lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nation was crushed by nation, and city by city, for God troubled them with every kind of distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you, be strong and do not lose courage, for there is a reward for your work.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Asa heard these words and the prophecy which Azariah the son of Oded the prophet spoke, he took courage and removed the abominable idols from all the land of Judah and Benjamin, and from the cities which he had captured in the hill country of Ephraim. He then restored the altar of the Lord which was in front of the porch of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he gathered all Judah and Benjamin, and those from Ephraim, Manasseh, and Simeon who resided with them, for many defected to him from Israel when they saw that the Lord his God was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they assembled at Jerusalem in the third month of the fifteenth year of Asa’s reign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sacrificed to the Lord on that day seven hundred oxen and seven thousand sheep from the spoils they had brought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They entered into the covenant to seek the Lord God of their fathers with all their heart and soul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whoever would not seek the Lord God of Israel was to be put to death, whether small or great, man or woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, they made an oath to the Lord with a loud voice, with shouting, trumpets, and with horns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Judah rejoiced concerning the oath, for they had sworn with all their heart and had sought Him earnestly, and He let them find Him. So the Lord gave them rest on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also removed Maacah, the mother of King Asa, from the position of queen mother, because she had made an abominable image as an Asherah, and Asa cut down her abominable image, crushed it, and burned it at the brook Kidron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the high places were not removed from Israel; nevertheless Asa’s heart was blameless all his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought into the house of God the dedicated things of his father and his own dedicated things: silver, gold, and utensils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was no more war until the thirty-fifth year of Asa’s reign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the thirty-sixth year of Asa’s reign, Baasha king of Israel came up against Judah and fortified Ramah in order to prevent anyone from going out or coming in to Asa king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Asa brought out silver and gold from the treasuries of the house of the Lord and the king’s house, and sent it to Ben-hadad king of Aram, who lived in Damascus, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A treaty must be made between you and me, as there was between my father and your father. Behold, I have sent you silver and gold; go, break your treaty with Baasha king of Israel so that he will withdraw from me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ben-hadad listened to King Asa, and he sent the commanders of his armies against the cities of Israel, and they conquered Ijon, Dan, Abel-maim, and all the storage cities of Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Baasha heard about it, he stopped fortifying Ramah and put an end to his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Asa brought all Judah, and they carried away the stones of Ramah and its timber with which Baasha had been building, and with it he fortified Geba and Mizpah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Hanani the seer came to Asa king of Judah and said to him, “Because you have relied on the king of Aram and have not relied on the Lord your God, for that reason the army of the king of Aram has escaped from your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Were not the Ethiopians and the Lubim an immense army with very many chariots and horsemen? Yet because you relied on the Lord, He handed them over to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the eyes of the Lord roam throughout the earth, so that He may strongly support those whose heart is completely His. You have acted foolishly in this. Indeed, from now on you will have wars.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Asa was angry with the seer and put him in prison, for he was enraged at him for this. And Asa mistreated some of the people at the same time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, the acts of Asa from the first to the last, behold, they are written in the Book of the Kings of Judah and Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the thirty-ninth year of his reign Asa became diseased in his feet. His disease was severe, yet even in his disease he did not seek the Lord, but the physicians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Asa lay down with his fathers, and died in the forty-first year of his reign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They buried him in his own tomb which he had cut out for himself in the city of David, and they laid him in the resting place which he had filled with spices of various kinds blended by the perfumers’ art; and they made a very great fire for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His son Jehoshaphat then became king in his place, and he proved himself strong over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He placed troops in all the fortified cities of Judah, and placed garrisons in the land of Judah and in the cities of Ephraim which his father Asa had captured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord was with Jehoshaphat because he followed the example of his father David’s earlier days and did not seek the Baals,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but sought the God of his father, followed His commandments, and did not act as Israel did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord established the kingdom in his control, and all Judah gave tribute to Jehoshaphat, and he had great riches and honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took great pride in the ways of the Lord, and again removed the high places and the Asherim from Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then in the third year of his reign he sent his officials, Ben-hail, Obadiah, Zechariah, Nethanel, and Micaiah, to teach in the cities of Judah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with them the Levites, Shemaiah, Nethaniah, Zebadiah, Asahel, Shemiramoth, Jehonathan, Adonijah, Tobijah, and Tobadonijah, the Levites; and with them the priests Elishama and Jehoram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They taught in Judah, having the Book of the Law of the Lord with them; and they went throughout the cities of Judah and taught among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the dread of the Lord was on all the kingdoms of the lands which were around Judah, so that they did not make war against Jehoshaphat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Philistines brought gifts and silver as tribute to Jehoshaphat; the Arabians also brought him flocks, 7,700 rams and 7,700 male goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jehoshaphat grew greater and greater, and he built fortresses and storage cities in Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had large supplies in the cities of Judah, and warriors, valiant mighty men, in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was their muster according to their fathers’ households: of Judah, commanders of thousands, Adnah was the commander, and with him three hundred thousand valiant warriors;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and next to him was Johanan the commander, and with him 280,000;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and next to him Amasiah the son of Zichri, who volunteered for the Lord, and with him two hundred thousand valiant warriors;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of Benjamin, Eliada, a valiant warrior, and with him two hundred thousand armed with bow and shield;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and next to him Jehozabad, and with him 180,000 equipped for war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the ones who served the king, apart from those whom the king put in the fortified cities throughout Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jehoshaphat had great riches and honor; and he allied himself by marriage to Ahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some years later he went down to visit Ahab at Samaria, and Ahab slaughtered many sheep and oxen for him and the people who were with him. And he incited him to go up against Ramoth-gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahab king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat king of Judah, “Will you go with me against Ramoth-gilead?” And he said to him, “I am as you are, and my people as your people, and we will be with you in the battle.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, “Please request the word of the Lord first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king of Israel assembled the prophets, four hundred men, and said to them, “Should we go to battle against Ramoth-gilead, or should I refrain?” And they said, “Go up, for God will hand it over to the king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jehoshaphat said, “Is there no longer a prophet of the Lord here, that we may inquire of him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “There is still one man by whom we may inquire of the Lord, but I hate him, for he never prophesies anything good regarding me, but always bad. He is Micaiah the son of Imlah.” But Jehoshaphat said, “May the king not say so.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Israel summoned an officer and said, “Bring Micaiah son of Imlah quickly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah were sitting, each on his throne, dressed in their robes, and they were sitting at the threshing floor at the entrance of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets were prophesying before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah made horns of iron for himself and said, “This is what the Lord says: ‘With these you will gore the Arameans until they are destroyed!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the prophets were prophesying this as well, saying, “Go up to Ramoth-gilead and be successful, for the Lord will hand it over to the king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the messenger who went to summon Micaiah spoke to him saying, “Behold, the words of the prophets are unanimously favorable to the king. So please let your word be like one of them, and speak favorably.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Micaiah said, “As the Lord lives, whatever my God says, I will speak it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came to the king, the king said to him, “Micaiah, should we go to battle against Ramoth-gilead, or should I refrain?” He said, “Go up and succeed, for they will be handed over to you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king said to him, “How many times must I make you swear that you will tell me nothing but the truth in the name of the Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he said,
“I saw all Israel
Scattered on the mountains,
Like sheep that have no shepherd.
And the Lord said,
‘These people have no master.
Each of them is to return to his house in peace.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “Did I not tell you that he would not prophesy anything good regarding me, but only bad?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Micaiah said, “Therefore, hear the word of the Lord. I saw the Lord sitting on His throne, and all the angels of heaven standing on His right and on His left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, ‘Who will entice Ahab king of Israel to go up and fall at Ramoth-gilead?’ And one spirit said this, while another said that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a spirit came forward and stood before the Lord and said, ‘I will entice him.’ And the Lord said to him, ‘How?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, ‘I will go out and be a deceiving spirit in the mouths of all his prophets.’ Then He said, ‘You shall entice him, and you will also prevail. Go out and do so.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, behold, the Lord has put a deceiving spirit in the mouths of these prophets of yours, for the Lord has declared disaster against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah approached and struck Micaiah on the cheek; and he said, “How did the Spirit of the Lord pass from me to speak to you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Micaiah said, “Behold, you are going to see how on that day when you go from one inner room to another trying to hide yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Israel said, “Take Micaiah and return him to Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the king’s son;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘This is what the king says: “Put this man in prison, and feed him enough bread and water to survive until I return safely.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Micaiah said, “If you actually return safely, the Lord has not spoken by me.” And he said, “Listen, all you people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah went up against Ramoth-gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “I will disguise myself and go into battle, but you put on your robes.” So the king of Israel disguised himself, and they went into battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the king of Aram had commanded the commanders of his chariots, saying, “Do not fight with the small or great, but only with the king of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the commanders of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, they said, “He is the king of Israel!” And they turned aside to fight against him. But Jehoshaphat cried out, and the Lord helped him, and God diverted them from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the commanders of the chariots saw that it was not the king of Israel, they turned back from pursuing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now one man drew his bow at random and struck the king of Israel in a joint of the armor. So he said to the driver of his chariot, “Turn around and take me out of the battle, for I am severely wounded.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The battle raged on that day, and the king of Israel propped himself up in his chariot in front of the Arameans until the evening; and at sunset he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehoshaphat the king of Judah returned in safety to his house in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehu the son of Hanani the seer went out to meet him and said to King Jehoshaphat, “Should you help the wicked and love those who hate the Lord, and by doing so bring wrath on yourself from the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there is some good in you, for you have removed the Asheroth from the land and you have set your heart to seek God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jehoshaphat lived in Jerusalem and went out again among the people from Beersheba to the hill country of Ephraim, and brought them back to the Lord, the God of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He appointed judges in the land in all the fortified cities of Judah, city by city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the judges, “Consider what you are doing, for you do not judge for mankind but for the Lord who is with you when you render judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then, let the fear of the Lord be upon you; be careful about what you do, for the Lord our God will have no part in injustice or partiality, or in the taking of a bribe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Jerusalem Jehoshaphat also appointed some of the Levites and priests, and some of the heads of the fathers’ households of Israel, for the judgment of the Lord, and to judge disputes among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he commanded them, saying, “This is what you shall do in the fear of the Lord, faithfully and wholeheartedly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever any dispute comes to you from your countrymen who live in their cities, between blood and blood, between law and commandment, statutes and ordinances, you shall warn them so that they will not be guilty before the Lord, and wrath will not come on you and your countrymen. This you shall do and you will not be guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, Amariah the chief priest will be over you in every matter that pertains to the Lord, and Zebadiah the son of Ishmael, the ruler of the house of Judah, in all that pertains to the king. Also the Levites shall be officers before you. Act resolutely, and may the Lord be with the upright.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about after this, that the sons of Moab and the sons of Ammon, together with some of the Meunites, came to make war against Jehoshaphat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some came and reported to Jehoshaphat, saying, “A great multitude is coming against you from beyond the sea, from Aram; and behold, they are in Hazazon-tamar (that is Engedi).”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoshaphat was afraid and turned his attention to seek the Lord; and he proclaimed a period of fasting throughout Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Judah gathered together to seek help from the Lord; they even came from all the cities of Judah to seek the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehoshaphat stood in the assembly of Judah and Jerusalem, in the house of the Lord in front of the new courtyard;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, “Lord, God of our fathers, are You not God in the heavens? And are You not ruler over all the kingdoms of the nations? Power and might are in Your hand so that no one can stand against You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did You not, our God, drive out the inhabitants of this land from Your people Israel, and give it to the descendants of Your friend Abraham forever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have lived in it, and have built You a sanctuary in it for Your name, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If disaster comes upon us, the sword, or judgment, or plague, or famine, we will stand before this house and before You (for Your name is in this house), and cry out to You in our distress, and You will hear and save us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now behold, the sons of Ammon, Moab, and Mount Seir, whom You did not allow Israel to invade when they came out of the land of Egypt (for they turned aside from them and did not destroy them),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: see how they are rewarding us by coming to drive us out from Your possession which You have given us as an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our God, will You not judge them? For we are powerless before this great multitude that is coming against us; nor do we know what to do, but our eyes are on You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Judah was standing before the Lord, with their infants, their wives, and their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then in the midst of the assembly the Spirit of the Lord came upon Jahaziel the son of Zechariah, the son of Benaiah, the son of Jeiel, the son of Mattaniah, the Levite of the sons of Asaph;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, “Listen, all you of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and King Jehoshaphat: This is what the Lord says to you: ‘Do not fear or be dismayed because of this great multitude, for the battle is not yours but God’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tomorrow, go down against them. Behold, they will come up by the ascent of Ziz, and you will find them at the end of the valley in front of the wilderness of Jeruel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You need not fight in this battle; take your position, stand and watch the salvation of the Lord in your behalf, Judah and Jerusalem.’ Do not fear or be dismayed; tomorrow, go out to face them, for the Lord is with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoshaphat bowed his head with his face to the ground, and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem fell down before the Lord, worshiping the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites, from the sons of the Kohathites and from the sons of the Korahites, stood up to praise the Lord God of Israel, with a very loud voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They rose early in the morning and went out to the wilderness of Tekoa; and when they went out, Jehoshaphat stood and said, “Listen to me, Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem: Put your trust in the Lord your God and you will endure. Put your trust in His prophets, and succeed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had consulted with the people, he appointed those who sang to the Lord and those who praised Him in holy attire, as they went out before the army and said, “Give thanks to the Lord, for His faithfulness is everlasting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they began singing and praising, the Lord set ambushes against the sons of Ammon, Moab, and Mount Seir, who had come against Judah; so they were struck down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the sons of Ammon and Moab rose up against the inhabitants of Mount Seir, completely destroying them; and when they had finished with the inhabitants of Seir, they helped to destroy one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator
