verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After all this, when Josiah had set the temple in order, Neco king of Egypt came up to wage war at Carchemish on the Euphrates, and Josiah went out to engage him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Neco sent messengers to him, saying, “What business do you have with me, King of Judah? I am not coming against you today, but against the house with which I am at war, and God has told me to hurry. For your own sake, stop interfering with God who is with me, so that He does not destroy you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, Josiah would not turn away from him, but disguised himself in order to fight against him; nor did he listen to the words of Neco from the mouth of God, but he came to wage war on the plain of Megiddo.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The archers shot King Josiah, and the king said to his servants, “Take me away, for I am badly wounded.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So his servants took him out of the chariot and carried him on the second chariot which he had, and brought him to Jerusalem where he died and was buried in the tombs of his fathers. All Judah and Jerusalem mourned for Josiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah chanted a song of mourning for Josiah. And all the male and female singers speak about Josiah in their songs of mourning to this day. And they made them an ordinance in Israel; behold, they are also written in the Lamentations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Josiah and his deeds of devotion as written in the Law of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his acts, the first to the last, behold, they are written in the Book of the Kings of Israel and Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people of the land took Joahaz the son of Josiah and made him king in place of his father in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joahaz was twenty-three years old when he became king, and he reigned for three months in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Egypt deposed him in Jerusalem, and imposed a fine on the land of a hundred talents of silver and one talent of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Egypt made Joahaz’s brother Eliakim king over Judah and Jerusalem, and changed his name to Jehoiakim. But Neco took his brother Joahaz and brought him to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned for eleven years in Jerusalem; and he did evil in the sight of the Lord his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up against him and bound him with bronze chains to take him to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nebuchadnezzar also brought some of the articles of the house of the Lord to Babylon, and he put them in his temple in Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim and the abominations which he committed, and what was found against him, behold, they are written in the Book of the Kings of Israel and Judah. And his son Jehoiachin became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoiachin was eighteen years old when he became king, and he reigned for three months and ten days in Jerusalem. He did evil in the sight of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the turn of the year King Nebuchadnezzar sent men and had him brought to Babylon with the valuable articles of the house of the Lord; and he made his relative Zedekiah king over Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned for eleven years in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did evil in the sight of the Lord his God; he did not humble himself before Jeremiah the prophet who spoke for the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also rebelled against King Nebuchadnezzar, who had made him swear allegiance by God. But he stiffened his neck and hardened his heart against turning to the Lord God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, all the officials of the priests and the people were very unfaithful, following all the abominations of the nations; and they defiled the house of the Lord which He had sanctified in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the Lord, the God of their fathers, sent word to them again and again by His messengers, because He had compassion on His people and on His dwelling place;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they continually mocked the messengers of God, despised His words, and scoffed at His prophets, until the wrath of the Lord rose against His people, until there was no remedy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He brought up against them the king of the Chaldeans, who killed their young men with the sword in the house of their sanctuary, and had no compassion on young man or virgin, old man or frail; He handed them all over to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought all the articles of the house of God, great and small, and the treasures of the house of the Lord, and the treasures of the king and his officers, to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they burned the house of God and broke down the wall of Jerusalem, and burned all its fortified buildings with fire and destroyed all its valuable articles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took into exile those who had escaped from the sword to Babylon; and they were servants to him and to his sons until the rule of the kingdom of Persia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to fulfill the word of the Lord by the mouth of Jeremiah, until the land had enjoyed its Sabbaths. All the days of its desolation it kept the Sabbath until seventy years were complete.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia—in order to fulfill the word of the Lord by the mouth of Jeremiah—the Lord stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia so that he sent a proclamation throughout his kingdom, and also put it in writing, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what Cyrus king of Persia says: ‘The Lord, the God of heaven, has given me all the kingdoms of the earth, and He has appointed me to build Him a house in Jerusalem, which is in Judah. Whoever there is among you of all His people, may the Lord his God be with him; go up then!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator
